panels.description: Displays the File.d version for the selected instance. When 'All' is selected, lists all detected versions.
panels.title: Version

panels.description: Amount of logs written by File.d in bytes.
panels.title: Logs size [1d]

panels.description: Displays the average uptime of all selected File.d instances in 'd hh:mm:ss format'. When 'All' is selected, shows the shortest (most recently restarted) uptime.
panels.title: Uptime

panels.description: Amount of logs consumed by File.d in bytes per second.
panels.title: Logs rate by size

panels.description: Amount of logs consumed by File.d in count per second.
panels.title: Logs rate by count

panels.description: Indicator whether there are banned sources or not.
panels.title: Antispam active

panels.description: Banned sources by source_name. For file or k8s input plugin source_name is filename.
panels.title: Antispam banned

panels.description: Rate of antispam exceptions applied by exception name from File.d config. Antispam exceptions are never banned.
panels.title: Antispam exceptions

panels.description: Amount of open file descriptors processed by File.d.
panels.title: Process open FDs

panels.description: Amount of open file descriptors of deleted files processed by File.d. If deleted file descriptors grow it means that File.d cannot process all of the events fast enough.
panels.title: Process deleted FDs

panels.description: Amount of events currently in use. If the value is the same as event pool capacity, it means that all events are busy and there are no free events to process new logs.
panels.title: Avg In Use Events by instance

panels.description: Amount of time for getting events from the event pool.
panels.title: Latency 99p

panels.description:
Amount of output write jobs completed. There are two types of jobs:
1) Finished by timeout
2) Finished by batch max size exceeded.
panels.title: Jobs done rate

panels.description: Average amount of batches in process of sending to output.
panels.title: Avg batches in progress

panels.description: Amount of time it takes to write events to the output.
panels.title: Output Latency

panels.description: Amount of time spent in waiting for correct sequential batches commit. So if there are 3 batches, 3rd batch completed sending faster, it will wait for the first two batches to complete before committing to the input.
panels.title: Waiting For Commit

panels.description: Total user and system CPU time spent in seconds.
panels.title: CPU usage

panels.description: Virtual memory size in bytes.
panels.title: Process virtual memory

panels.description: Resident memory size in bytes. It reflects the amount of real physical memory used.
panels.title: Process resident memory

panels.description: How many bytes of memory in total is taken from system by Go
panels.title: Taken system memory

panels.description: Number of allocated objects.
panels.title: Memstat heap objects

panels.description: Number of bytes allocated and still in use.
panels.title: Allocated total

panels.description: Total number of bytes allocated, even if freed.
panels.title: Rate of allocated memory

panels.description: Number of heap bytes allocated and still in use.
panels.title: Heap allocated

panels.description: Shows how many bytes are in idle spans. Idle spans have no objects in them. These spans could be (and may already have been) returned to the OS, or they can be reused for heap allocations, or they can be reused as stack memory.
panels.title: Heap idle

panels.description: Number of heap bytes released to OS.
panels.title: Heap released to OS

panels.description: How many bytes of memory could be released, but is kept by runtime, so that runtime can allocate objects on the heap without asking OS for more memory.
panels.title: Heap could be released

panels.description: Bytes of memory is used by stack memory spans, which have atleast one object in them.
panels.title: Stack in use

panels.description: Bytes are obtained from OS for mspan structures.
panels.title: mspan sys

panels.description: Bytes are in use by mspan structures.
panels.title: mspan in use

panels.description: How many times Go's garbage collector runs per minute in File.d.
panels.title: GO GC runs per minute

panels.description: Total time spent in Go GC pauses over 5 minutes in File.d.
panels.title: GO GC time per 5 minutes

panels.description: A summary of the pause duration of garbage collection cycles.
panels.title: GO GC duration max

panels.description: A summary of the pause duration of garbage collection cycles.
panels.title: GO GC duration, 0.75q

panels.description: Number of goroutines that currently exist.
panels.title: Goroutines count

panels.description: Number of OS threads created.
panels.title: Threads count

panels.description: Top 10 writers by logs size. Change k8s_pod_label_app to your matching labels to get the correct info.
panels.title: Top 10 size

panels.description: Top 10 writers by logs count. Change k8s_pod_label_app to your matching labels to get the correct info.
panels.title: Top 10 count
